newsitem.title: UK: Cory Towage says it has won tanker berthing deal.
newsitem.headline: Cory Towage says it has won tanker berthing deal.

text.p: Cory Towage said Thursday it has signed a long term contract for the provision of tanker berthing and oil barge movements at St. Eustatius in the Netherlands Antilles.
The division of Ocean Group Plc said it has agreed a five year contract for a two tug service with Statia Terminals. The main user of the terminal is Saudi Aramco.
Ocean Group director of corporate affairs Tony Lascelles said the Cory Towage was tendering for a number of similar contracts.
"The future potential for the business is in growing international tug contracts. Towage is very profitable with a high return on capital," he said.
Ocean Group reported today that Cory Towage's operating profit fell 3.5 percent to 5.5 million sterling in the first six months of 1997.

The group said growth was limited in the UK where major ports benefited from increased volumes, but this was offset by the impact of vessel disposals. -Reuters Shipping News + 44 171 542 4087. Fax 5017.
